sentences.expr: The estimated transformation parameters  $g$  are used to define the 2-D warping  $\mathcal{T}_{g}$ :
sentences.label: definition

sentences.expr: Using  $\mathcal{T}_{g}$ , it is possible to warp the source to the target image
sentences.label: usecase
definition

sentences.expr: The proposed soft-inlier count  $c$  is differentiable with respect to the transformation parameters  $g$  as long as the geometric transformation  $\mathcal{T}_{g}$  is differentiable  , which is the case for a range of standard geometric transformations such as 2D affine, homography or thin-plate spline transformations
sentences.label: usecase

sentences.expr: The inlier mask  $m$  can be computed by warping an identity mask  $m^{\mathit{Id}}$  with the estimated transformation  $\mathcal{T}_{g}$ , where  $m^{\mathit{Id}}$  is constructed by thresholding the reprojection error of the identity transformation:
sentences.label: usecase

sentences.expr:
Given an image pair, the model produces a thin-plate spline geometric transformation  $\mathcal{T}_{g}$  which aligns the two images;
 $\mathcal{T}_{g}$  has 18 degrees of freedom
sentences.label: definition
